full_text:
10.27 FROM-RJRT GOVT. RELATIONS
ID:19107414401
·PAGE
18/20
SCOTTY BAESLER
AGRICULTURS
VETERANS" AFFAUIRS
-1124
Congtes's of the United Sptates
House of Represeqitatibes
BMasbiegton, DC 20515
February 1, 1996
The Honorable Paul Patton
Governor of Keutucky
The Capitol
700 Capital Avantue
Prankfort, KY 40601
Dear Governor Patton:
The purpose of my lottor is to voice my support for your etforts to pass legislation in the Keptucky
General Assembly to probibit the sale of tobecco products to minors. Your afforts prove thut even
tobacco producing state wre willing to effoctively deal with the issve without the need for excessive
federal regulation.
Although Keutuciy contains the largost buriey tobaapo growing regioms in the country, all of us
understand ths wisdom of proveathng children from smoiding Howover, wo dread roest efforts almed at
wrongheaded snd wouid do inreperable harm to the ocooomies of states such as Keatucky.
Indood, studies show that even smokets dou't weet their kids to smoice. I am deeply concerned with the
iswue of teen sutoicing, aad I think we must taike strong stape to prevent them from forming this habit. At
the sarne time, however, I am also concerned about the impact of the potential FD A rogulation on
Kentucky's agricultural economy.
I believe Semate Bill 137 belences theso conpurs. In fast, SB 137 provides a comprebeasive and realistic
remedy for combating toenago amoking in the Combarwrealth of Keutcky. It imposes, for the first
tione, significant pumelties and finee for tho sale and direrlbution of toleece products to minors. The
logisletion also contains a socmd enforoement mecheniem dasigmed to ensure complience. It also provides
a strategy and timeframe for achleving the goal of combatting youth smoking.
More importaandy, SB I37 bullds upon the fremgwrork outined in the recently proposed SAMHSA
(Substmce Abuso and Mental Heelth Services Administration) regularlons. I belleve your legislation will
serve as a natiomal model for what stated can do to probibit the sale of tobecco products to childrem. It is
my bope that your legtslation, and similar legislation introduced by Secator Wendell Ford and myself on
the Congressional level, will serve to derail eftorts by the FDA to assume regulatory control over
tobacco.
Thank you for baiing the lead ou this mater.
Sincerely,
Sootty Bacalef
Member of Congress
